nytimes.title: How One Stupid Tweet Blew Up Justine Sacco’s Life
nytimes.topComment: Social media is, on the whole, a very bad thing. It wastes time, gives at best ephemeral pleasure with a modicum of interest, causes privacy and necessary social boundaries to disintegrate, and enriches people very much at the expense of others. Anyo...

nytimes.title: Gov. John Kitzhaber of Oregon Resigns Amid Crisis
nytimes.topComment:
"She will also be the state’s first openly bisexual governor."

There is no where in this piece that this would be relevant. Really? What color underwear does she wear?

nytimes.title: Gail Collins: Scott Walker Needs an Eraser
nytimes.topComment: Well, the citizens of Wisconsin get to test the old adage, if you think that education is expensive, try ignorance! Walker is another panderer-supreme. That someone so unimpressive and vacuous can be taken as a serious contender is a shameful comment...

nytimes.title: Op-Ed | Timothy Egan: Jon Stewart’s America
nytimes.topComment:
Dear JoStew:

Thank you for the laughs, and thank you for leaving.

For we enjoyed the show, but we made not a whit of a difference to the sociopolitical or economic situation that had produced the mirth.

We celebrated the unfairness, absurdity, inc...

nytimes.title: David Carr, Times Critic and Champion of Media, Dies at 58
nytimes.topComment: I don't think I've ever felt this strongly about the death of a public person. I feel like I've been kicked in the stomach. David Carr's fierce love of the Times, his hard-earned moral authority and his beautiful writing made the world a better, more...
